column4: How do I kick ubuntu in the guts enough that it notices I just put the SD card back in?
the pid (process ID) is the 1234 bit
sudo kill 1234  <-- that will kill the process
open a new shell then and type "ps ax | grep locate"
the first number on the resulting line is the pid
Anyone know anything about my question above?
(well .. if 21" is a laptop .. Dell XPS M2010 :-))
Sometimes it works, sometimes it don't
if it were a standard card reader, I'd just unplug/plug it and it would be seed by hald
Is THX-1138 a bot spouting random tips or did I just miss the context?
i got an external card reader
